items.name: AnimatedSprite
items.summary: Animates a series of sprites over time.

items.name: spriteRenderer
items.summary: The sprite renderer component for the animation (Read only).

items.name: sprites
items.summary: The sprites that are rendered throughout the animation, in order.

items.name: frameRate
items.summary: The amount of frames per second that are rendered.

items.name: nextFrameTime
items.summary: The time at which the next frame will begin (Read only).

items.name: frame
items.summary: The current frame index (Read only).

items.name: reversed
items.summary: Animates the sprites in reverse order.

items.name: loop
items.summary:
Whether the animation should loop back to the start after cycling
through each sprite.

items.name: Restart()
items.summary: Restarts the animation to the first frame.

items.name: AnimatorParameter
items.remarks:
A hash id is automatically created for the parameter. Ids are used for
optimized setters and getters on Animator parameters.
items.summary: An animation parameter that can be set on an Animator.

items.name: hash
items.summary: The hash id of the animator parameter (Read only).

items.name: name
items.summary: The name of the animator parameter.

items.name: AnimatorParameter(String)
items.summary: Creates a new animator parameter with the given name.

parameters.description: The name of the animator parameter.

items.name: Implicit(String to AnimatorParameter)
items.summary: Implicitly converts a name to an animator parameter.

syntax.content: public static implicit operator AnimatorParameter(string name)

parameters.description: The name of the animator parameter.

return.description: A new animator parameter with the given name.

items.name: Implicit(AnimatorParameter to Int32)
items.summary: Implicitly converts an animator parameter to a hash id.

syntax.content: public static implicit operator int (AnimatorParameter property)

parameters.description: The animator parameter to convert to an id.

return.description: The hash id of the animator parameter.

items.name: Blink
items.summary: Switches a material on and off on an object at a variable rate.

items.name: renderer
items.summary: A reference to the main blinking object's renderer (Read only).

items.name: sharedRenderers
items.summary:
An array of other renderers whos material will be changed to match
the blinking object.

items.name: blinkingMaterial
items.summary: The material applied to the object when blinking.

items.name: notBlinkingMaterial
items.summary: The material applied to the object when not blinking.

items.name: blinkChance
items.summary: The random chance that the object will blink.

items.name: blinkDuration
items.summary: The amount of seconds the material stays blinking.

items.name: blinkCooldown
items.summary:
The amount of seconds before the material can blink a subsequent
time.

items.name: updateInterval
items.summary:
How frequently in seconds the script will execute as a way to
optimize the code performance.

items.name: nextUpdateTime
items.summary: The time the next update will be performed (Read only).

items.name: blinking
items.summary: Whether the object is currently blinking (Read only).

items.name: cooldown
items.summary: Whether the blinking is currently on cooldown (Read only).

items.name: BlinkOnce()
items.summary: Blinks the material for one cycle.

items.name: FollowPath.LoopType
items.summary: A type of looping behavior.

items.name: None
items.summary: Turns off looping.

items.name: Restart
items.summary:
Restarts the object from the beginning of the path after it
reaches the end. The object will jump to the position of the
first node.

items.name: Circular
items.summary:
After reaching the end of the path, the object will traverse
back to the first node and continue with the next loop.

items.name: PingPong
items.summary:
The object traverses along the path forwards then backwards then
forwards then backwards, etc.

items.name: FollowPath
items.summary: Moves an object along a predefined path.

items.name: path
items.summary: The transform comprising of all the child nodes in the path.

items.name: nodeFrom
items.summary:
The transform of the node that the object is currently moving from
(Read only).

items.name: nodeTo
items.summary:
The transform of the node that the object is currently moving to
(Read only).

items.name: currentIndex
items.summary:
The index of the node that the object is currently moving to
(Read only).

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the object moves between nodes. Small numbers make the
object more responsive. Larger numbers make the object respond more
slowly.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: The maximum speed the object can move between nodes.

items.name: minProximity
items.summary:
Once the object is less than this distance to the current node, then
it will advance to the next one.

items.name: looping
items.summary: The looping behavior, if desired.

items.name: reversed
items.summary: Moves the object between nodes in reverse.

items.name: Restart()
items.summary: Restarts the path at the first node.

items.name: IAnimationCurve<T>
items.summary: A type that can be represented with animation curves.

typeParameters.description: The type evaluated by the animation curve.

items.name: Evaluate(Single)
items.summary: Evaluate the curve at the specified time.

parameters.description: The time within the curve you want to evaluate (the horizontal axis in the curve graph).

return.description: The value of the curve, at the point in time specified.

items.name: AddKey(Single, T)
items.summary: Adds a new key to the curve.

parameters.description: The time at which to add the key (horizontal axis in the curve graph).
The value for the key (vertical axis in the curve graph).

items.name: RemoveKey(Int32)
items.summary: Removes a key.

parameters.description: The index of the key to remove.

items.name: Move
items.summary: Moves an object in space by a given speed.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed at which the object moves.

items.name: space
items.summary: The coordinate space in which the object moves.

items.name: updateMode
items.summary: The update mode during which the object moves.

items.name: Orbit
items.summary: Orbits an object around another object with a given speed and radius.

items.name: center
items.summary: The transform the object orbits around.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed at which the object orbits.

items.name: radius
items.summary: The distance from the center of the object being orbited.

items.name: startAngle
items.summary: The initial angle in degrees of the orbiting object.

items.name: angle
items.summary: The current angle in degrees of the orbiting object (Read only).

items.name: updateMode
items.summary: The update mode during which the object orbits.

items.name: Rotate
items.summary: Rotates an object in space by a given speed.

items.name: axis
items.summary: The axis in which the object rotates.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed at which the object rotates.

items.name: space
items.summary: The coordinate space in which the object rotates.

items.name: updateMode
items.summary: The update mode during which the object rotates.

items.name: RotateAround
items.summary: Rotates an object around a point by a given speed.

items.name: point
items.summary: The point to rotate around.

items.name: axis
items.summary: The axis in which the object rotates.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed at which the object rotates.

items.name: updateMode
items.summary: The update mode during which the object rotates.

items.name: Scale
items.summary: Scales an object over time by a given speed.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed at which the object's scale changes.

items.name: updateMode
items.summary: The update mode during which the object's scale changes.

items.name: SmoothDamp<T>
items.summary:
Gradually changes a value over time using a spring-damper function,
which will never overshoot.

typeParameters.description: The type of value to be animated.

items.name: value
items.summary: The current value (Read only).

syntax.content: public T value { get; protected set; }

items.name: velocity
items.summary:
The current velocity, this value is modified by the function every
time you call it (Read only).

syntax.content: public T velocity { get; protected set; }

items.name: smoothTime
items.summary:
Approximately the time it will take to reach the target. A smaller
value will reach the target faster.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: Optionally allows you to clamp the maximum speed.

items.name: Update(T)
items.summary: Smoothes the current value to the target value.

parameters.description: The target value.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: Update(T, Single)
items.summary:
Smoothes the current value to the target value
with the given delta time.

syntax.content: public abstract T Update(T target, float deltaTime)

parameters.description: The target value.
The time since the last call to this function.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: SmoothDampFloat
items.summary:
Gradually changes a float over time using a spring-damper function,
which will never overshoot.

items.name: Update(Single)
items.summary: Smoothes the current value to the target value.

parameters.description: The target value.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: Update(Single, Single)
items.summary:
Smoothes the current value to the target value
with the given delta time.

syntax.content: public override float Update(float target, float deltaTime)

parameters.description: The target value.
The time since the last call to this function.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: SmoothDampVector2
items.summary:
Gradually changes a Vector2 over time using a spring-damper function,
which will never overshoot.

items.name: Update(Vector2)
items.summary: Smoothes the current value to the target value.

parameters.description: The target value.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: Update(Vector2, Single)
items.summary:
Smoothes the current value to the target value
with the given delta time.

syntax.content: public override Vector2 Update(Vector2 target, float deltaTime)

parameters.description: The target value.
The time since the last call to this function.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: SmoothDampVector3
items.summary:
Gradually changes a Vector3 over time using a spring-damper function,
which will never overshoot.

items.name: Update(Vector3)
items.summary: Smoothes the current value to the target value.

parameters.description: The target value.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: Update(Vector3, Single)
items.summary:
Smoothes the current value to the target value
with the given delta time.

syntax.content: public override Vector3 Update(Vector3 target, float deltaTime)

parameters.description: The target value.
The time since the last call to this function.

return.description: The new current value.

items.name: SmoothFollow
items.summary:
Moves toward the position of another transform using a smooth damping
function.

items.name: target
items.summary: The transform to follow.

items.name: offset
items.summary:
The local offset position from the target's position that the camera
moves toward.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the transform moves toward the target's position. Small
numbers make the transform more responsive. Larger numbers make the
transform respond more slowly.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: The maximum amount of units the transform can move per tick.

items.name: SmoothLookAt
items.summary:
Rotates toward the position of another transform using a smooth damping
function.

items.name: target
items.summary: The transform to look at.

items.name: offset
items.summary:
The local offset position from the target's position that the camera
looks at.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the transform rotates toward the target's position.
Small numbers make the transform more responsive. Larger numbers
make the transform respond more slowly.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: The maximum amount of degrees the transform can rotate per update.

items.name: Timing
items.summary: The start and end time of an animation.

items.name: start
items.summary: The start time of the animation.

items.name: end
items.summary: The end time of the animation.

items.name: Timing(Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates a new timing with the specified values.

parameters.description: The start time of the animation.
The end time of the animation.

items.name: Random()
items.summary: Returns a random time within the start and end time.

return.description: A random time within the start and end time.

items.name: Includes(Single)
items.summary: Checks if a time is within the start and end time.

parameters.description: The time to check.

return.description: True if the time is within the start and end time.

items.name: Timing01
items.summary: The start and end time of an animation normalized between 0 and 1.

items.name: start
items.summary: The start time of the animation, between 0 and 1.

items.name: end
items.summary: The end time of the animation, between 0 and 1.

items.name: Timing01(Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates a new timing with the specified values.

parameters.description: The start time of the animation, between 0 and 1.
The end time of the animation, between 0 and 1.

items.name: Random()
items.summary: Returns a random time within the start and end time.

return.description: A random time within the start and end time.

items.name: Includes(Single)
items.summary: Checks if a time is within the start and end time.

parameters.description: The time to check.

return.description: True if the time is within the start and end time.

items.name: TimingRange
items.summary: An animation timing range between a lower and upper bound.

items.name: min
items.summary: The lower bound of the timing range.

items.name: max
items.summary: The upper bound of the timing range.

items.name: TimingRange(Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates a new timing range with the specified values.

parameters.description: The lower bound of the timing range.
The upper bound of the timing range.

items.name: Random()
items.summary: Returns a random time within the min and max time.

return.description: A random time within the min and max time.

items.name: Includes(Single)
items.summary: Checks if a time is within the min and max time.

parameters.description: The time to check.

return.description: True if the time is within the min and max time.

items.name: TimingRange01
items.summary: An animation timing range normalized between 0 and 1.

items.name: min
items.summary: The lower bound of the timing range, between 0 and 1.

items.name: max
items.summary: The upper bound of the timing range, between 0 and 1.

items.name: TimingRange01(Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates a new timing range with the specified values.

parameters.description: The lower bound of the timing range, between 0 and 1.
The upper bound of the timing range, between 0 and 1.

items.name: Random()
items.summary: Returns a random time within the min and max time.

items.name: Includes(Single)
items.summary: Checks if a time is within the min and max time.

parameters.description: The time to check.

return.description: True if the time is within the min and max time.

items.name: UpdateMode
items.summary: An update mode during which an animation behavior can run.

items.name: Update
items.summary: Updates during the normal loop, once every frame.

items.name: LateUpdate
items.summary: Updates after all other update functions, once every frame.

items.name: FixedUpdate
items.summary: Updates during the physics loop at a fixed timestep.

items.name: Vector2AnimationCurve
items.summary:
Stores a collection of keyframes that can be evaluated over time as a
Vector2.

items.name: x
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the x-axis of a Vector2.

items.name: y
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the y-axis of a Vector2.

items.name: Evaluate(Single)
items.summary: Evaluate the curve at the specified time.

parameters.description: The time within the curve you want to evaluate (the horizontal axis in the curve graph).

return.description: The value of the curve, at the point in time specified.

items.name: AddKey(Single, Vector2)
items.summary: Adds a new key to the curve.

syntax.content: public void AddKey(float time, Vector2 value)

parameters.description: The time at which to add the key (horizontal axis in the curve graph).
The value for the key (vertical axis in the curve graph).

items.name: RemoveKey(Int32)
items.summary: Removes a key.

parameters.description: The index of the key to remove.

items.name: Vector3AnimationCurve
items.summary:
Stores a collection of keyframes that can be evaluated over time as a
Vector3.

items.name: x
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the x-axis of a Vector3.

items.name: y
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the y-axis of a Vector3.

items.name: z
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the z-axis of a Vector3.

items.name: Evaluate(Single)
items.summary: Evaluate the curve at the specified time.

parameters.description: The time within the curve you want to evaluate (the horizontal axis in the curve graph).

return.description: The value of the curve, at the point in time specified.

items.name: AddKey(Single, Vector3)
items.summary: Adds a new key to the curve.

syntax.content: public void AddKey(float time, Vector3 value)

parameters.description: The time at which to add the key (horizontal axis in the curve graph).
The value for the key (vertical axis in the curve graph).

items.name: RemoveKey(Int32)
items.summary: Removes a key.

parameters.description: The index of the key to remove.

items.name: Vector4AnimationCurve
items.summary:
Stores a collection of keyframes that can be evaluated over time as a
Vector4.

items.name: x
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the x-axis of a Vector4.

items.name: y
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the y-axis of a Vector4.

items.name: z
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the z-axis of a Vector4.

items.name: w
items.summary: The collection of keyframes for the w-axis of a Vector4.

items.name: Evaluate(Single)
items.summary: Evaluate the curve at the specified time.

parameters.description: The time within the curve you want to evaluate (the horizontal axis in the curve graph).

return.description: The value of the curve, at the point in time specified.

items.name: AddKey(Single, Vector4)
items.summary: Adds a new key to the curve.

syntax.content: public void AddKey(float time, Vector4 value)

parameters.description: The time at which to add the key (horizontal axis in the curve graph).
The value for the key (vertical axis in the curve graph).

items.summary: Removes a key.

parameters.description: The index of the key to remove.
